newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait Airways studies offers to finance Boeing BA.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait Airways studies offers to finance Boeing BA.

text.p: The national flag carrier Kuwait Airways Corp started on Wednesday reviewing offers to finance the $280 million purchase of two new Boeing Co 777-200s, a senior official said.
"The finance committee met on Wednesday and started the review process. It shall meet again on November 24," added the Kuwait Airways official.
A final decision on the tender which closed on Sunday could be announced in mid-December after review by the airline's board of directors and the state's accounting body, he added.
The carrier is seeking financing for the two aircraft ordered in July for delivery in 1998. It has an option on a third 777 twinjet.
Officials said several international and regional banks and finance houses had presented offers, including:

CitiBank and Chase of the United States, Japan's Sumitomo Bank, the Bahrain-based Gulf International Bank, a consortium of Kuwaiti banks under National Bank of Kuwait and Kuwait's The International Investor Co.
The new 777s will replace two Boeing 747s currently in service. The airline also operates 15 Airbus Industrie aircraft.
